item.title: Rats in Churchill Gardens, Bromley., 8th August
item.description:
In Churchill Gardens Bromley, I see Rats every day running into The Scrubs. It’s disgusting. This has been happening for a number of Weeks Now.

item.title: Continous rubbish disposal on the pavement/ Silwood Street, 8th August
item.description:
This is an ongoing, continuous problem that has been reported to you (Southwark Council) since last year (indicatively see case FixMyStreet ref: 6328084). I am providing to you a photo which was taken today (8 August 2025@2:57pm) showing the blatant pollution that is happening from this specific binshed which apparently belongs to the nearby Costcutter . Myself I reported to you last summer a similar problem (FixMyStreet ref: 6294734.) but apparently whoever is the owner of the binshed simply doesn't give a damn about publich health & hygiene rules. On a similar note Soutwark Council continues NOT to properly cleaning Silwood Street which sadly looks in a very neglected condition. When I reached out to your relevant team (Corporate complaint 42872701) the answer I got was: "the relevant cleaning supervisor, and he has inspected the location of Sillwood Street today. He has said that the street was in a clean state with minimal litter, this is as expected for this point of the cleaning schedules. He has explained that the location in question is litter picked three times per week and scheduled for Tuesday, Thursday and Saturdays". Southwark Council please get your act together both in terms of enforcing the law for those who are breaking it and also do something about the continuous deterioration of your cleaning and maintenance services. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 177, Rotherhithe New Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste propped against the lamppost in the street, 8th August
item.description:
The Three Hounds (business operating out of 57 Beckenham Road) dumps its waste (rubbish bags, cardboard, etc) on the street while awaiting collection from a private waste collection company. The rubbish pile builds throughout the day, quite often restricting the width of the pavement, until it is collected late in the evening. The Three Hounds should keep their waste on-site until the waste collection company arrive to take it away. This happens every day and has been going on for about a year.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Beckenham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog Fouling, 8th August
item.description:
There is a huge volume of dog fouling in Bromley around Haywwod Road. On almost every street I walk on around this area (Jaffray road, Southland Road, Homesdale Road, Havelock Road) I will come across dog faeces. What can be done to enforce responsible dog ownership?! It is really disgusting!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haywood Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet
